label: 市司
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Divided into the Eastern Market Office (Higashi-no-ichi-no-tsukasa) and the Western Market Office (Nishi-no-ichi-no-tsukasa ), the former being in charge of the market for the Left Division of the Capital (Sakyō) and hence under the jurisdiction of the Office of the Capital, Left Division (Sakyōshiki ), while the latter was in charge of the market for the Right Division of the Capital (Ukyō ), and was therefore under the jurisdiction of the Office of the Capital, Right Division (Ukyōshiki ). Kept order in the markets, regulated prices, guarded against fake goods, inspected weights and measures, controlled trading, etc. There were other markets beside these two in Kyōto. [右京、右京識]
